body:
Here's a much simpler example:

    $ cat example.txt
    1 2 3

    $ grep -Po "[0-9]+" example.txt
    1
    2
    3

    $ rg -o "[0-9]+" example.txt -N
    1
    1
    1

@s3rb31 if you want to take a stab it, I believe the bug is here: https://github.com/BurntSushi/ripgrep/blob/master/src/printer.rs#L311 Instead of running the regex again, it should use the original match data to get the start & end.

The column is ok, while data is not:

```
~/ripgrep$ cat tests/digits.txt 
1 2 3
~/ripgrep$ cargo run -- "\d" tests/digits.txt -o -n --column
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.0 secs
     Running `target/debug/rg '\d' tests/digits.txt -o -n --column`
1:1:1
1:3:1
1:5:1
```

issue.title: Fix reiteration of the first found match with --only-mathing flag

repository.name: ripgrep
repository.description: ripgrep recursively searches directories for a regex pattern while respecting your gitignore

issue.body:
Fixes #451 

```
~/ripgrep$ cat tests/digits.txt 
1 2 3
123
~/ripgrep$ cargo run -- "\d" tests/digits.txt -o --column
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.0 secs
     Running `target/debug/rg '\d' tests/digits.txt -o --column`
1:1:1
1:3:2
1:5:3
2:1:1
2:2:2
2:3:3
~/ripgrep$ cargo run -- "\d+" tests/digits.txt -o --column
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.0 secs
     Running `target/debug/rg '\d+' tests/digits.txt -o --column`
1:1:1
1:3:2
1:5:3
2:1:123

```

body:
Oh, this was really quick. Thanks for the fix!

I compiled it and it performs well and solid until now. Will report back if I encounter more bugs.

Thanks again!

issue.title: Error on searching on oneline texts with option --only-matching

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: An issue that is duplicative of another.

repository.name: ripgrep
repository.description: ripgrep recursively searches directories for a regex pattern while respecting your gitignore

issue.body:
When searching in oneline text (e.g. minified json) with option `--only-matching`, I got the result only first match.

```bash
$ rg --version
ripgrep 0.5.1
$ cat ./test.json 
[{"character":"a","code":"U+0061"},{"character":"b","code":"U+0062"},{"character":"c","code":"U+0063"},{"character":"d","code":"U+0064"},{"character":"e","code":"U+0065"},{"character":"f","code":"U+0066"},{"character":"g","code":"U+0067"}]
$ rg '"character":"[\w]"' ./test.json 
1:[{"character":"a","code":"U+0061"},{"character":"b","code":"U+0062"},{"character":"c","code":"U+0063"},{"character":"d","code":"U+0064"},{"character":"e","code":"U+0065"},{"character":"f","code":"U+0066"},{"character":"g","code":"U+0067"}]
$ rg '"character":"[\w]"' -o ./test.json 
1:"character":"a"
1:"character":"a"
1:"character":"a"
1:"character":"a"
1:"character":"a"
1:"character":"a"
1:"character":"a"
```

issue.title: Different behaviour from grep/ag with -o and multiple matches

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: An issue that is duplicative of another.

repository.name: ripgrep
repository.description: ripgrep recursively searches directories for a regex pattern while respecting your gitignore

issue.body:
With grep:

```
$ echo '50k + 1k + 11k + 37k + 18k' | grep -Po '[\d.]+'
50
1
11
37
18
```

With The Silver Searcher:

```
$ echo '50k + 1k + 11k + 37k + 18k' | ag -o '[\d.]+'
50
1
11
37
18
```

With ripgrep:

```
$ echo '50k + 1k + 11k + 37k + 18k' | rg -o '[\d.]+'
50
50
50
50
50
```

```
$ rg -V
ripgrep 0.5.1
```
